snippet: A New York State appellate court heard arguments on whether a chimpanzee can be considered a “legal person,” and if he can sue for his freedom.
abstract: New York State appellate court hears arguments on whether Tommy, chimpanzee located in Gloversville, NY, can be considered a legal person and sue for his freedom with human aid; case was brought by the Nonhuman Rights Project, group that is now appealing after a lower-court judge ruled that Tommy had not been unlawfully imprisoned by his owners.
lead_paragraph: A New York State appellate court heard arguments on whether a chimpanzee can be considered a “legal person,” and if he can sue for his freedom.

headline.main: Judges Hear Chimp’s Plea to Be Free, and Retired
headline.print_headline: Judges Hear Chimp’s Plea to Be Free, and Retired
